result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L. Tatro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L. Tatro

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony L. Tatro in court with attorney Shawn Michael Behrens.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:04 am. State gives plea agreement, plea to charge court costs. Victim rights have been complied. Restitution however no documentation given to DA. Atty Behrens and def. agree with plea agreement.  $6,000 Restitution has already been paid to victim and request no hearing be set, victim had right to be at sentencing. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understand charge & penalties. Ct 1 Theft, Guilty plea.  Def. advised of constitutional  & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Behrens is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Theft.  State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Behrens gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. makes statement.  Court orders on ct 1, court costs, no DNA sample, Def. will pay today. Issue of Restitution, money has been returned to victim. Victim may file a small claim.  DA's victim coordinator need to contact victim.  Court will leave restitution open for 30 days. DA needs to set for hearing.  No restitution ordered today. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Anthony L. Tatro in court with attorney Shawn Michael Behrens.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 9:05 a.m.  State has filed amended complaint.  Ct 1 Misdemeanor theft, statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Waive reading of complaint.  Amended complaint received.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will receive plea.  Bond will continue.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony L. Tatro in court with attorney Shawn Michael Behrens.  Ralph Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 1:37 pm.  Atty Behrens has copy of complaint, waives reading, & waives time limits.  State gives bond recommendation. Court orders $2500.00 Signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
